rules.natural: Whenever the forest habitat is protected for tigers, the forest has high biodiversity.
Either the forest habitat is protected for tigers or funding is approved for the conservation program.
A disease outbreak happens in the forest or community support exists for the forest or government support exists for the forest.
Human settlement expands in the forest or, whenever a disease outbreak occurs in the forest, a quarantine is imposed.
In case conservation is successful in the forest, the tiger population is stable in the forest.
If conservation is successful in the forest, then the food chain is intact in the forest.
Either conservation is successful in the forest or conservation has failed in the forest.
If conservation has failed in the forest, then human settlement does not expand in the forest.
In case the tiger population is stable in the forest, tiger breeding is successful.
Whenever there is international cooperation for the forest, then if the tiger population is stable in the forest, human settlement does not expand.
If funding is approved for the conservation program, then tiger survival is secured in the forest.
If research is conducted in the forest, then tiger survival is secured in the forest.
Research is conducted in the forest or an education program exists for the forest.
In case an education program exists for the forest, awareness has increased about the forest.
Logging is permitted in the forest or, in case awareness has increased about the forest, tiger survival is secured.
If the forest has protected status, then logging is not permitted in the forest.
Mining is proposed for the forest or development is not allowed in the forest.
Under the condition that deer prey is abundant in the forest, tiger survival is secured in the forest.
If clean water is maintained in the forest, then pollution does not increase in the forest.
Climate change affects the forest or clean water is maintained in the forest.
The temperature is stable in the forest or climate change does not affect the forest.
Provided that scientific study is conducted in the forest, then if tiger breeding is successful, human settlement does not expand in the forest.
If data is collected in the forest, then scientific study is conducted in the forest.
Whenever research funding is provided for the forest, data is collected in the forest.
In case the predator-prey balance exists in the forest, human settlement does not expand in the forest.
Invasive species are present in the forest or, if the food chain is intact in the forest, the predator-prey balance exists.
If the forest ecosystem is balanced, then deer prey is abundant in the forest.
Under the condition that a conservation policy exists for the forest, enforcement is weak in the forest.
If a conservation policy exists for the forest, then enforcement is not weak in the forest.
A conservation policy exists for the forest or invasive species are not present in the forest.
Disease is contained in the forest or a disease outbreak does not occur in the forest.
If veterinary care is provided in the forest, then a vaccination program exists or disease is not contained.
Medical supplies are available in the forest or veterinary care is provided in the forest.
If a habitat corridor exists in the forest, then in case tigers are at risk of extinction, the population is not declining.
Either a habitat corridor exists in the forest or a migration route exists for the forest.
In case a migration route exists for the forest, then if tigers are at risk of extinction, the population is not declining.
Under the condition that there is corporate sponsorship for the forest, there is private funding for the forest.

Either corporate sponsorship exists for the forest or, if it is not the case that tourism is developed in the forest or whenever it is not true that if tiger survival is not secured then the habitat is destroyed implies poaching is controlled, monitoring is not implemented, then sustainable development occurs in the forest.
If air quality is good in the forest, then pollution does not increase in the forest.
In case emissions are controlled in the forest, air quality is good in the forest.
Provided that anti-poaching efforts have failed in the forest, poaching of tigers has increased.
If community support exists for the forest, then tiger survival is secured in the forest.
Whenever government support exists for the forest, tiger survival is secured in the forest.
If it is not the case that if the tiger population is stable in the forest then human settlement does not expand, then the tiger population is declining.
Provided that it is not true that whenever the tiger population is stable in the forest, human settlement does not expand, then tigers are at risk of extinction.

If it is not true that tourism is developed in the forest or whenever it is not the case that if tiger survival is not secured then the habitat is destroyed implies poaching is controlled, monitoring is not implemented, then there is economic benefit from the forest.

If it is not the case that tourism is developed in the forest or whenever it is not the case that if tiger survival is not secured then the habitat is destroyed implies poaching is controlled, monitoring is not implemented, then sustainable development does not occur in the forest.
Provided that it is not the case that whenever the forest has high biodiversity, the forest ecosystem is balanced, then anti-poaching efforts have failed in the forest.
If it is not the case that whenever it is not true that if tiger survival is not secured then the habitat is destroyed implies poaching is controlled, then monitoring is implemented in the forest.
In case the forest does not have protected status, then development is allowed in the forest.
Provided that tiger survival is not secured in the forest, then pollution has increased in the forest.
